      This method pulls the info form the customers table in the database and translates it into an array of customer objects to be used throughout the code

      Gets the ID value of the contact the user selects from the contact combo box in the appointments screens

      This method translates the "Contact ID" from the database in the name of the contact to be used in the appointment form

      This creates a List of String objects filled with Contact names from the database table contacts to populate a combo box on the AppointmentAdd and AppointmentModify screens.

      static java.lang.String getDivision_ID​(java.lang.String city)
      This method is used to take in the named city in the Customer object and convert it to a Division_Id to relate to the Country-level information in the Database.

      This method tanslates the "Division_ID" from the customer table to translate it into actual location names
      static javafx.collections.ObservableList getLocations​(java.lang.Integer countryID)
      This takes in the countryID input from the Customer create/edit screens's combo boxes and uses that country code to output a string list of first-level locations to be used to populate the first-level/location combo box.
      static java.lang.Integer getNewApptID()
      This will create a unique appointment id for a user-created appointment by parsing a list of all appointment id's, pulling out the largest value, then adding 1 to it to set a new, unique appointment
      static java.lang.Integer getNewCustomerID()
      This will take in all the ID's from the customers table in the database, find out the largest one, and then add one to it to create a new/unique ID for a newly created customer.
      static void getTime()
      This Method is the most basic of the get time methods.
      static java.lang.Integer getUserID​(java.lang.String userName)
      This will take the name of the user logged into the system and return their id number.
      static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> ifCustHasApptDoYouDelete​(java.lang.Integer customerID)
      This will take in a customer id, run it through the appointments table in the database, and return a matching appointment if it finds one linked to the customer.
      static java.lang.String loginControl​(java.lang.String userName)
      This will send through the inputted username, match it to an existing user's password, then return the password in the database for that user to check it against the user-entered password

      This will take a selected appointment and delete it from the database
      static boolean removeApptFromDataByID​(java.lang.Integer appointmentID)
      This method takes the appointment ID in, queries the database for a matching appointment, and then deletes that matching appointment from the database.

      Simple method to remove the Customer from the database by parsign the Customer Object for the customer's ID number, which is also used in the Database to identify the customer.

      This report generates a schedule for each contact in the organization
      static java.lang.String thirdReport()
      This report generates the number of customers in each country and then sorts them by their first-level location

      • loginControl

        public static java.lang.String loginControl​(java.lang.String userName)
                                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        This will send through the inputted username, match it to an existing user's password, then return the password in the database for that user to check it against the user-entered password
        Parameters:
        userName - this is input from the login screen
        Returns:
        returns the password that matches the input userName
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getDivision_ID

        public static java.lang.String getDivision_ID​(java.lang.String city)
        This method is used to take in the named city in the Customer object and convert it to a Division_Id to relate to the Country-level information in the Database.
        Parameters:
        city - This is the Customer object's city (of residence - for example, New York, etc.)
        Returns:
        this returns the Database's integer value for the named city.

      • getCountryFromDivision

        public static java.lang.Integer getCountryFromDivision​(java.lang.String Division_ID)
        This is a small method that is used in part to populate a combo box in the CustomerInfoModifyController. What it does is takes in the Division_ID from the Customer object that is passed into the CustomerInfoModifyController and Converts it to the associated COUNTRY_ID number. This number will thn be used to pre-select the Customer object's Country in their address.
        Parameters:
        Division_ID - This input is used in the SQL Query to pull the equivalent Country ID variable to the Division ID
        Returns:
        integer value of the Country_ID to be used in other SQL queries for pulling the name of the country.

      • getLocations

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList getLocations​(java.lang.Integer countryID)
        This takes in the countryID input from the Customer create/edit screens's combo boxes and uses that country code to output a string list of first-level locations to be used to populate the first-level/location combo box.
        Parameters:
        countryID - this is taken in from the ComboBox on either the CustomerInfoAdd or CustomerInfoModify screens
        Returns:
        sends back an array filled with first-level locations to populate the combo box on the method-calling scene

      • getFirstLevelName

        public static java.lang.String getFirstLevelName​(java.lang.String divisionID)
                                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method tanslates the "Division_ID" from the customer table to translate it into actual location names
        Parameters:
        divisionID - comes from the customer table
        Returns:
        the name of the place with the divisionID that matches the customer table
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • removeCustomerFromDatabase

        public static boolean removeCustomerFromDatabase​(Customer customer)
        Simple method to remove the Customer from the database by parsign the Customer Object for the customer's ID number, which is also used in the Database to identify the customer. The query then deletes any customer record with the same ID number as the Customer object passed into this method.
        Parameters:
        customer - This is the Customer object that the user of the program wishes to delete from the database.
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean value of true if the process was a success, false if it was a failure or if an error was thrown.

      • addModCustomerToDatabase

        public static boolean addModCustomerToDatabase​(Customer customer)
        When a customer object is modified in the main program, this method updates the customer record in the database.
        Parameters:
        customer - This is the representation of the customer inside the main program. The data contained in the object is parsed through and added as an update to an existing customer row in the database.
        Returns:
        true if the process was a success, false if it failed or if an error happens.

      • checkForCustomerAppointments

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> checkForCustomerAppointments​(java.lang.Integer customerID)

      • ifCustHasApptDoYouDelete

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> ifCustHasApptDoYouDelete​(java.lang.Integer customerID)
                                                                               throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        This will take in a customer id, run it through the appointments table in the database, and return a matching appointment if it finds one linked to the customer.
        Parameters:
        customerID - the Customer ID that is being queried to match to any/all appointments
        Returns:
        True if there is an appointment matched, false if not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException

      • addCustomerToDatabase

        public static boolean addCustomerToDatabase​(Customer customer)
        Used to add a newly created Customer Object from the main program into the database as a new customer row.
        Parameters:
        customer - The new customer object we wish to parse and add to the database.
        Returns:
        True if the customer was successfuly added to the database, false if not or if error happens.

        Returns:

        Returns:
        an integer value of a new appointment ID

        java.sql.SQLException

      • getNewCustomerID

        public static java.lang.Integer getNewCustomerID()
                                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        This will take in all the ID's from the customers table in the database, find out the largest one, and then add one to it to create a new/unique ID for a newly created customer.
        Returns:
        the new Customer ID
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
